float.name: idle_priority_per_angle_degree
float.comment:
CAUTION: Angle priority on ships that do broadsides introduces a target ping pong. For example, Target A is directly in front of the ship and B is off to the right at 90 degrees, both at equal distance. A would be selected based on angle priority, but the ship must turn to shoot A. The act of turning would make the ship point towards B, and that results in a switch to B. The ship turning to shoot B would now cause A to become the new best target, and so on and so forth.
Since broadside ships have guns on both sides, it actually doesn't really matter if a target is behind them... they can turn to any side less than 90 degrees and hit the desired target. Zeroing the priority per angle is also a perf bonus.
TODO: If the target range is larger than weapon range, we might need to make use of distance behind filter to avoid the ship turning around and moving backwards to engage target behind it. This is technically already an issue if you were to give a stationary ship an attack move order and the only target is in attack move targeting range but out of weapon range.
